$comment: This schema describes the constraints of a plugin manifest for third party developers to be deployed to Microsoft 365 Copilot
title: API Plugin manifest object
description: The root of the plugin manifest document is a JSON object that contains members that describe the plugin.

schema_version.description: The schema version. Previous versions are `v1`, `v2`, `v2.1`, `v2.2`, and `v2.3`.

name_for_human.description: A short, human-readable name for the plugin. It MUST contain at least one nonwhitespace character. Characters beyond 20 MAY be ignored. This property is localizable.

namespace.description: An identifier used to prevent name conflicts between function names from different plugins that are used within the same execution context. The value MUST match the regex ^[A-Za-z0-9-]+ as defined by [RFC9485]. This is a required member.

description_for_model.description: The description for the plugin that is provided to the model. This description should describe what the plugin is for, and in what circumstances its functions are relevant. Characters beyond 2048 MAY be ignored. This property is localizable.

description_for_human.description: A human-readable description of the plugin. Characters beyond 100 MAY be ignored. This property is localizable.

logo_url.description: A URL used to fetch a logo that MAY be used by the orchestrator. Implementations MAY provide alternative methods to provide logos that meet their visual requirements. This property is localizable.

contact_email.description: An email address of a contact for safety/moderation, support, and deactivation.

legal_info_url.description: An absolute URL that locates a document containing the terms of service for the plugin. This property is localizable.

privacy_policy_url.description: An absolute URL that locates a document containing the privacy policy for the plugin. This property is localizable.

functions.description: A set of function objects describing the functions available to the plugin. Each function object name MUST be unique within the array. The order of the array isn't significant. If the `functions` property isn't present and there's an OpenAPI runtime, the functions are inferred from the OpenAPI operations.

runtimes.description: A list of runtime configurations that determine how functions are invoked.

conversation_starters.description: Conversation starters that can be displayed to the user for suggestions on how to invoke the plugin.

function-object.title: Function object
function-object.description: Information related to how the model should interact with a function.

name.description: A string that uniquely identifies this function. Runtime objects MAY reference this identifier to bind the runtime to the function. When the function is bound to an OpenAPI runtime, the value must match an `operationId` value in the OpenAPI description.

description.description: A description better tailored to the model, such as token context length considerations or keyword usage for improved plugin prompting.

parameters.description: An object that contains members that describe the parameters of a function in a runtime agnostic way. It mirrors the shape of [json-schema][] but only supports a small subset of the JSON schema capabilities. If the `parameters` property isn't present, functions described by a runtime object of type `OpenApi` use the OpenAPI description to determine the parameters. Each member in the JSON object is a function parameter object that describes the semantics of the parameter.

returns.description: Describes the semantics of the value returned from the function.

states.title: Function states object
states.description: Defines state objects for orchestrator states.

reasoning.description: The state in which the model can call functions and do computations.

responding.description: The state in which the model can generate text that is shown to the user. The model can't invoke functions in the responding state.

capabilities.title: Function capabilities object
capabilities.description: Contains a collection of data used to configure optional capabilities of the orchestrator while invoking the function.

confirmation.description: Describes a confirmation dialog that SHOULD be presented to the user before invoking the function.

response_semantics.description: Describes how the orchestrator can interpret the response payload and provide a visual rendering.

security_info.description: Describes the security information to be used to aid in determining the relative risk of invoking the function.

response-semantics-object.title: Response semantics object
response-semantics-object.description: Contains information to identify semantics of response payload and enable rendering that information in a rich visual experience using [adaptive cards](https://adaptivecards.io/).

data_path.description: A JSONPath [RFC9535][] query that identifies a set of elements from the function response to be rendered using the template specified in each item.

properties.title: Response semantics properties object
properties.description: Allows mapping of JSONPath queries to well-known data elements. Each JSONPath query is relative to a result value.

title.description: Title of a citation for the result.

subtitle.description: Subtitle of a citation for the result.

url.description: URL of a citation for the result.

thumbnail_url.description: URL of a thumbnail image for the result.

information_protection_label.description: Data sensitivity indicator of the result contents.

template_selector.description: A JSONPath query that returns an [Adaptive Card Template](https://learn.microsoft.com/adaptive-cards/templating/language) from the API response to be used for rendering the result.

static_template.description: A JSON object that either: conforms with the [Adaptive Card Schema](https://adaptivecards.io/schemas/adaptive-card.json) and templating language, or contains a `file` property that references a file containing the Adaptive Card Schema. This Adaptive Card instance is used to render a result from the plugin response. This value is used if the `template_selector` isn't present or fails to resolve to an adaptive card. If using the file reference option, the value of `file` MUST be a relative path to a JSON file containing a valid Adaptive Card Schema. The path is relative to the location of the manifest document.

oneOf.description: An inline Adaptive Card definition that conforms with the Adaptive Card Schema and templating language.
A file reference to an Adaptive Card definition. The file property MUST contain a relative path to a JSON file containing a valid Adaptive Card Schema.

file.description: A relative path to a JSON file containing a valid Adaptive Card Schema. The path is relative to the location of the manifest document.

oauth_card_path.description: A JSON string containing a JSONPath query that when applied to the response payload will return an [Adaptive Card Template](https://learn.microsoft.com/adaptive-cards/templating/language) that will be used to authenticate the user.

conversation-starter.title: Conversation starter object
conversation-starter.description: An example of a question that the plugin can answer.

text.description: The text of the conversation starter. This property is localizable.

title.description: The title of the conversation starter. This property is localizable.

runtime.description: Defines how a specific runtime invokes functions, including auth and spec details.

type.description: The type of runtime. Must be 'OpenApi', 'LocalPlugin', or 'RemoteMCPServer'.

run_for_functions.description: The names of the functions that are available in this runtime. A single wildcard ("*") value can be provided to enable all functions in the OpenAPI description. More than one runtime MUST NOT declare support for the same function either implicitly or explicitly.

output_template.description: A Liquid template used to transform the plugin response payload.

auth-object.title: Runtime authentication object
auth-object.description: Contains information used by the plugin to authenticate to the runtime.

type.description: Specifies the type of authentication required to invoke a function.

Type.description: Specifies the type of authentication required to invoke a function.

reference_id.description: A value used when `type` is `OAuthPluginVault` or `ApiKeyPluginVault`. The `reference_id` value is acquired independently when providing the necessary authentication configuration values. This mechanism exists to prevent the need for storing secret values in the plugin manifest.

open-api-spec.description: Configuration for invoking an OpenAPI-based runtime.

url.description: The URL to the OpenAPI specification (ignored if api_description is present).

api_description.description: A string that contains an OpenAPI description. If this member is present, `url` isn't required and is ignored if present.

progress_style.description: A JSON string that contains the progress style that will be used to display the progress of the function. The value MUST be one of the following values: None, ShowUsage, ShowUsageWithInput, ShowUsageWithInputAndOutput.

local-plugin-spec.description: Configuration for invoking a local plugin runtime.

local_endpoint.description: A JSON string that represents a local runtime identifier that links to a specific function to invoke locally (e.g. in the case of Windows it will link to a particular app). In the case of an Office Addin that is implementing the function, the value MUST be the string Microsoft.Office.Addin.

allowed_host.description: An optional JSON array of enumerated strings that can take values as mail, workbook, document or presentation. The value represent the host apps this LocalPlugin can run-in.

mcp-execution-spec.description: Configuration for invoking a remote MCP server runtime.

url.description: A JSON string that represents the URL of the MCP server. This URL MUST be a valid absolute URL. This member is required when the type is RemoteMCPServer.

mcp_tool_description.description: A JSON object that contains either a reference to an external MCP tool description file or inline tool definitions. When present, this indicates that static tool definitions should be used instead of dynamic discovery. When absent, the runtime MUST use dynamic tool discovery by calling the MCP server's tools/list method.

mcp-tool-file-reference.title: MCP Tool File Reference
mcp-tool-file-reference.description: A reference to an external MCP tool description file.

file.description: A string that identifies the relative path to the MCP tool description file within the app package. The file MUST be a valid JSON file that contains tool descriptions matching the format returned by the MCP server's tools/list method.

mcp-tool-inline.title: MCP Tool Inline Definitions
mcp-tool-inline.description: Inline tool definitions matching the format returned by the MCP server's tools/list method.

function-parameters.title: Function parameters object
function-parameters.description: An object that is used to identify the set of parameters that can be passed to the function. This object is structured to mirror the shape of a JSON Schema object but it only supports a subset of JSON Schema keywords.

properties.title: Function parameters properties object
properties.description: An object that maps parameter names to their definitions.

^[A-Za-z0-9_]+$.description: The parameter definition that corresponds to the parameter that matches the property name.

required.description: The names of properties that are required parameters. Unlike in JSON Schema, the values in this array MUST match the names listed in the `properties` property.

function-parameter.title: Function parameter object
function-parameter.description: An object that describes the semantics of a function parameter.

items.description: A function parameter object that describes a single element in an array. MUST only be present when `type` is `array`.

enum.description: An array of valid values for this parameter. MUST only be present when `type` is `string`.

default.description: A value of the type specified by the `type` property that indicates the value the API uses when a value for an optional parameter isn't provided.

simple-function-parameter.title: Simple function parameter object
simple-function-parameter.description: An object that describes the semantics of a simple function parameter.

enum.description: An array of valid values for this parameter. MUST only be present when `type` is `string`.

default.description: A value of the type specified by the `type` property that indicates the value the API uses when a value for an optional parameter isn't provided.

function-return-type.title: Return object
function-return-type.description: Contains the semantics of the value returned from the function.

type.description: Specifies the type of the value returned by the API.

description.description: A description of the value returned by the API.

function-rich-response-return-type.title: Rich return object
function-rich-response-return-type.description: Indicates that the function returns a response that is compatible with the Rich Responses protocol.

function-state-config.title: State object
function-state-config.description: Contains specific instructions for when a function is invoked in a specific orchestrator state.

description.description: Describes the purpose of a function when used in a specific orchestrator state.

instructions.description: A string or an array of strings that are used to provide instructions to the orchestrator on how to use this function while in a specific orchestrator state. Providing a single string indicates the intent to provide a complete set of instructions that would override any built-in function prompts. Providing an array of strings indicates the intent to augment the built-in function prompting mechanism.

examples.description: A string or an array of strings that are used to provide examples to the orchestrator on how this function can be invoked.

confirmation-object.title: Confirmation object
confirmation-object.description: Describes how the orchestrator asks the user to confirm before calling a function.

title.description: The title of the confirmation dialog. This property is localizable.

body.description: The text of the confirmation dialog. This property is localizable.

isNonConsequential.description: Indicates the function is non-consequential. If true users may choose Always Allow. Default false. For OpenAPI GET only and ignored if x-oai-isConsequential is present or method != GET.

security-info-object.title: Security info object
security-info-object.description: Describes the security information to be used to aid in determining the relative risk of invoking the function.

data_handling.description: An array of strings that describe the data handling behavior of the plugin.
